it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.controller

Interface PersistentView

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Remote, RemoteObserver<ModelUpdate>, RemoteView, ViewEventVisitor
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PersistentViewImpl

    public interface PersistentView
extends RemoteView, ViewEventVisitor
    Represents an extension of the View of a player, which is used by the controller.
    Requests

    This enables the controller classes to make ChoiceRequests to the user and receive a CompletableChoice in response to each request. When the user makes the choice, that CompletableChoice will be completed. When the timer is not running, all requests made with sendChoiceRequest(ChoiceRequest) will return a pre-cancelled CompletableChoice

    Timer

    This also has the ability to keep a timer for the player to respond to requests. When this timer expires, the following things will happen:

    1. All the pending CompletableChoices are cancelled.
    2. The provided callback is called
    Network faults

    The methods exposed by this interface do not throw IOException: if a remote call fails, the caller of the method (a controller class) doesn't need to be notified about that. But if a network fault is detected, i.e. if an IOException is thrown when calling a method on the remote view, the following will happen:

    1. All the pending CompletableChoices are cancelled.
    2. If the timer is running, it gets stopped
    3. If a callback has been provided with setNetworkFaultCallback(Callable) (Callable)}, it gets called
    Persistence

    This view is associated to the player from the beginning till the end of the match, even if he disconnects. Then it can also handle the reconnection of the player.

    Updates

    Updates are sent asynchronously if calling RemoteObserver.update(Object), in order not to block the model However, if an update has to be sent synchronously, the method updateSync(ModelUpdate) is provided

    Author:
    Alessandro Fulgini

    • Method Detail

      • startTimer

        void startTimer(Callable<?> callback,
                long delay,
                TimeUnit unit)
        Starts a timer for this particular player. If a timer is running, this will stop it and start the new one
        Parameters:
        callback - the function that will be called when the timer expires
        delay - the duration of the timer
        unit - the time unit for delay

      • stopTimer

        void stopTimer()
        Stops the running timer. If there is no running timer, it does nothing

      • isTimerRunning

        boolean isTimerRunning()
        Checks if the timer is running
        Returns:
        true if the timer is running, false if not

      • disconnectRemoteView

        void disconnectRemoteView()
        Forces the disconnection of the internal remote view, if it is connected. The disconnection is then treated as a network fault

      • reconnectRemoteView

        boolean reconnectRemoteView(RemoteView view)
        Substitutes the remote view of the player with the provided one. In detail:
        • If network faults have already been detected, the substitution is guaranteed
        • If network faults have not been detected, a ping is sent to the client to detect network problems. If the ping doesn't succeed, the reconnection happens; if it does succeed, then the reconnection doesn't happen
        Parameters:
        view - the view of the player who wants to reconnect
        Returns:
        true if reconnection goes fine, false otherwise

      • setReconnectionCallback

        void setReconnectionCallback(Callable<?> callback)
        Sets the function to be called when a reconnection happens
        Parameters:
        callback - the function to be called when a reconnection happens

      • setNetworkFaultCallback

        void setNetworkFaultCallback(Callable<?> callback)
        Sets the function to be called when a network fault is detected
        Parameters:
        callback - the function to be called when a network fault is detected

      • hasNetworkFault

        boolean hasNetworkFault()
        Returns if a network fault has been detected with the remote. Note that this does not try to contact the remote to check connectivity, but reports if a network fault has been detected in previous method calls
        Returns:
        if a network fault has been detected

      • sendChoiceRequest

        <T extends Serializable> CompletableChoice<T> sendChoiceRequest(ChoiceRequest<T> request)
        Sends a request to the player and returns an object that can be used to retrieve the response to that request
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of choices
        Parameters:
        request - the request to be sent, not null
        Returns:
        a completable choice which can be used to retrieve the user's choice
